title: Unearthing InSights into Mars: Unsupervised Source Separation with Limited Data. (arXiv:2301.11981v2 [cs.LG] UPDATED)
abstract: Source separation involves the ill-posed problem of retrieving a set of source signals that have been observed through a mixing operator. Solving this problem requires prior knowledge, which is commonly incorporated by imposing regularity conditions on the source signals, or implicitly learned through supervised or unsupervised methods from existing data. While data-driven methods have shown great promise in source separation, they often require large amounts of data, which rarely exists in planetary space missions. To address this challenge, we propose an unsupervised source separation scheme for domains with limited data access that involves solving an optimization problem in the wavelet scattering covariance representation space$\unicode{x2014}$an interpretable, low-dimensional representation of stationary processes. We present a real-data example in which we remove transient, thermally-induced microtilts$\unicode{x2014}$known as glitches$\unicode{x2014}$from data recorded by a seis

translated_title: 发掘火星内部的信息:利用有限数据进行无监督源分离
translated_abstract: 源分离是一种病态问题，它涉及检索一组通过混合算子观测到的源信号。解决这个问题需要先验知识，通常通过对源信号施加正则条件或通过从现有数据的监督或无监督方法中隐式地学习来实现。虽然数据驱动的方法在源分离方面表现出了很大的潜力，但它们通常需要大量的数据，在行星空间任务中很少存在。为了解决这个挑战，我们提出了一种无监督源分离方案，适用于有限数据访问领域，其中涉及在小波散射协方差表示空间中解决一个优化问题——这是一种可解释的，低维的稳态过程表示。我们提出了一个实际数据例子，其中我们从记录了地震数据的数据中移除了瞬态的热诱导微倾斜，称为故障。
tldr: 该论文提出了一种无监督的源分离方法，用于有限数据访问领域，在小波散射协方差表示空间中解决优化问题，用于分离行星空间任务中记录的信号。
en_tdlr: The paper proposes an unsupervised source separation method for domains with limited data access, which involves solving an optimization problem in the wavelet scattering covariance representation space. It aims to separate the observed signals recorded in planetary space missions.
